article:
'Tantalum' is a chemical element with the symbol 'Ta' and atomic number 73.
Previously known as tantalium, the name comes from [[Tantalus]], a character
from Greek mythology. Euripides, [[Orestes (play)|Orestes]] Tantalum
is a rare, hard, blue-gray, lustrous transition metal that is highly corrosion
resistant. It is part of the refractory metals group, which are widely used as
minor components in alloys. The chemical inertness of tantalum makes it a
valuable substance for laboratory equipment and a substitute for platinum, but
its main use today is in tantalum capacitors in electronic equipment such as
mobile phones, DVD players, video game systems and computers. Tantalum, always
together with the chemically similar niobium, occurs in the minerals tantalite,
columbite and coltan (a mix of columbite and tantalite).
